results.title: Str8 outta Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Iconic images of Melbourne city flash on and off the screen to the beat of the boys from the burbs, rap performers, Jesse Galofaro and Somchay Phakonkham.
Contains two versions: 00:14-03:51 - unedited and uses coarse language 03:58-07:40 - edited (no coarse language)

results.title: The MutleyMedia Booth
results.brief_description: Provides a descriptive run-down of the machinations of the ACMI MutleyMedia Booth through a presentation taken from a walk through that will play on the Booth’s three screens. Two short films - Pneumatic and Chinagirl - embedded in the presentation represent the 16 original works by Australian artists made for screening inside the Booth.

results.title: 2 Spellbound
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and audio
results.brief_description: Les Leveque takes Alfred Hitchcock’s classic psychoanalysis and memory loss thriller and injects it with a large dose of adrenalin. What remains is a speeded up frenzy of image, light and hardcore techno music as Ingrid Bergman and Gregory Peck flash before our eyes, subverting our own memory of the film into a hazy waking dream.

results.title: Home
results.brief_description: A doco on “home” and “homelessness” - what is a “home” and what does “homelessness” mean to those who live it? The film provides a personal insight and commentary from a cross-section of the homeless community in Melbourne along with those who are lucky enough not to have experienced the social alienation, loneliness and hardships of homelessness. Thought-provoking and experimental in its presentation, Home is beautifully produced and directed by Amanda Sykes, with stunning images by cinematographer Brett Brogan, and supported by an evocative sound design and score from Pip Atherstone-Reid.

results.title: Trans
results.brief_description:
A seed pod blown from a tree lands on a rural powerline. The resulting spark starts a chain reaction, and a power surge travels ‘upstream’ towards the city grid. ‘Trans’ is an interpretation of the butterfly effect, how a tiny event can help to change things on a much larger scale.
Music soundtrack by Gareth Burnell, Luke Hales and Adam Swain.

results.title: Backstage
results.brief_description: A stunning and fascinating claymation short film presenting an honest and frank interview by phone with a strip dancer. The viewer is taken backstage to share Prisilla’s thoughts, feelings and impressions about life and experiences in this somewhat notorious and non-traditional industry.

results.title: Hoarse
results.brief_description:
Clever use of claymation brings to life this amazingly frenetic and captivating tale of one bro’s horse-riding adventures as he regales with enthusiasm about his “bestest” horse and his “bestest” accident.
Contains frequent use of coarse language.
